title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (http://contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/

Import Various Northern and Southern Hemisphere Climate
    Indices
text: development version

title:
Import Various Northern and Southern Hemisphere Climate
    Indices
text: Download Oceanic Nino Index data quick plot illustrate data:
code: oni <- download_oni() head(oni) #> # A tibble: 6 x 7 #>    Year Month Date       dSST3.4   ONI ONI_month_window phase              #>   <int> <ord> <date>       <dbl> <dbl> <chr>            <fct>              #> 1  1950 Jan   1950-01-01   -1.62 NA    <NA>             <NA>               #> 2  1950 Feb   1950-02-01   -1.32 -1.34 JFM              Cool Phase/La Nina #> 3  1950 Mar   1950-03-01   -1.07 -1.17 FMA              Cool Phase/La Nina #> 4  1950 Apr   1950-04-01   -1.11 -1.18 MAM              Cool Phase/La Nina #> 5  1950 May   1950-05-01   -1.37 -1.07 AMJ              Cool Phase/La Nina #> 6  1950 Jun   1950-06-01   -0.74 -0.85 MJJ              Cool Phase/La Nina barcols <- c('#edf8b1','#7fcdbb','#2c7fb8')  barplot(oni$ONI, names.arg = oni$Date, ylab = "Oceanic Nino Index" ,      col = barcols[oni$phase], border = NA, space = 0,     xaxt = "n")

title:
Import Various Northern and Southern Hemisphere Climate
    Indices

Download Dipole Mode Index (DMI) — download_dmi
text: Intensity IOD represented anomalous SST gradient  western equatorial Indian Ocean (50E-70E 10S-10N)  south eastern equatorial Indian Ocean (90E-110E 10S-0N).  gradient named Dipole Mode Index (DMI).  DMI positive , phenomenon refereed positive IOD negative, refereed negative IOD.

what: Download Southern Oscillation Index and Oceanic Nino Index data — download_enso
title: Download Southern Oscillation Index and Oceanic Nino Index data — download_enso
text: Southern Oscillation Index defined standardized difference barometric readings Darwin, Australia Tahiti. Oceanic Nino Index average sea surface temperature Nino 3.4 region (120W 170W) averaged three months. Phases categorized Oceanic Nino Index: Warm phase El Nino/ Southern Oscillation 3-month average sea-surface temperature departure positive 0.5 degC Cool phase La Nina/ Southern Oscillation 3-month average sea-surface temperature departure negative 0.5 degC Neutral phase defined three month temperature average +0.5 -0.5 degC

title: Download Southern Oscillation Index and Oceanic Nino Index data — download_enso
Download Southern Oscillation Index and Oceanic Nino Index data — download_enso
text: climate_idx Choose ENSO related climate index output. Current arguments supported soi (Southern Oscillation Index), oni (Oceanic Nino Index), npgo (North Pacific Gyre Oscillation) . outputs supported index variable slimmer dataset individual climate index call. create_csv Logical option create local copy data. Defaults FALSE.

title: Download Southern Oscillation Index and Oceanic Nino Index data — download_enso
text: Date: Date object uses first month placeholder. Date formatted date first month R supports one partial date time Month: Month record Year: Year record ONI: Oceanic Oscillation Index phase: ENSO phase SOI: Southern Oscillation Index NPGO: North Pacific Gyre Oscillation

title: Download Southern Oscillation Index and Oceanic Nino Index data — download_enso

what: Download Multivariate ENSO Index Version 2 (MEI.v2) — download_mei
title: Download Multivariate ENSO Index Version 2 (MEI.v2) — download_mei
text: MEI.v2 based EOF analysis level pressure,  sea surface temperature, surface zonal winds, surface meridional winds, Outgoing Longwave Radiation. analysis conducted 12 partially  overlapping 2-month "seasons". Warm phase defined MEI index greater equal 0.5. Cold phase  defined MEI index lesser equal -0.5.

what: Download Pacific Decadal Oscillation Data — download_pdo
title: Download Pacific Decadal Oscillation Data — download_pdo
text: PDO index derived leading principal monthly SST anomalies North Pacific Ocean, poleward 20N. monthly mean global average SST anomalies removed separate  pattern variability "global warming" signal may present data. NCEI PDO index based NOAA's extended reconstruction SSTs (ERSST Version 4).  constructed regressing ERSST anomalies Mantua PDO index  overlap period, compute PDO regression map North Pacific ERSST anomalies.  ERSST anomalies projected onto map compute NCEI index.  NCEI PDO index closely follows Mantua PDO index.

what: El Nino/Southern Oscillation (ENSO) and Related Climate Indices — rsoi-package
title: El Nino/Southern Oscillation (ENSO) and Related Climate Indices — rsoi-package
text: Downloads Southern Oscillation Index, Oceanic Nino Index, North Pacific Gyre Oscillation data, North Atlantic Oscillation Arctic Oscillation. Data sources described help files function.

title: El Nino/Southern Oscillation (ENSO) and Related Climate Indices — rsoi-package
